items.title: Betting stocks fall as NFL prediction bets gain on gambling apps
items.description: Platforms like Kalshi and Polymarket reported surging activity last week during the beginning of the NFL playoff season.

items.title: How a series of calculated risks led a BNY executive to the C-suite of America’s oldest bank
items.description: In a CEO search, small moments can end a candidacy instantly.

items.title: Bill Gates isn’t even close to America’s largest private landowner. It’s ‘Silent Stan’ Kroenke, Walmart husband and LA Rams owner
items.description: Kroenke’s purchase of nearly 1 million acres of ranchland marks a growing trend of the ultrawealthy snapping up farmland as an alternative asset.

items.title: Dominion Energy wins bid to resume wind project Trump halted
items.description: The ruling marks the third time this week that an offshore wind project was allowed to resume despite a government stop-work order.

items.title: When Jamie Dimon poached a top Berkshire exec, he called Warren Buffett, who said ‘If he’s going anywhere, at least he’s going to you’
items.description: Former Geico CEO Todd Combs had been at Berkshire since 2010.
